sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a regular polygon.
message_1: An equilateral triangle has a perimeter of 30cm. What is the perimeter of a regular hexagon with the same side length as that of the equilateral triangle?
message_2:
An equilateral triangle has three equal sides. To find the side length, we can divide the perimeter by the number of sides:

Side length of equilateral triangle = Perimeter / 3 = 30 cm / 3 = 10 cm

A regular hexagon has six equal sides. Since the hexagon has the same side length as the equilateral triangle, each side of the hexagon is also 10 cm long.

To find the perimeter of the hexagon, we can multiply the side length by the number of sides:

Perimeter of hexagon = Side length × 6 = 10 cm × 6 = 60 cm

The perimeter of the regular hexagon is 60 cm.
